programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod Schulz and Dave Hester explore a maze-like storage centre and set their sights on hand-crafted bamboo fishing rods.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A first edition of The Adventures of Bob Hope comic gets Rick and Chum chuckling, and an ancient Egyptian mummy mask gets Corey all wrapped up.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Limited edition Batman and Joker Bolin Guitars swoop into the shop, and a bronze sculpture by ML Snowden also grabs the attention.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.sub-title: To Catch a Thief - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. The Golds set up an elaborate sting to catch the thief and hope they have enough evidence to involve the police.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions are at an all-time high in the store as Seth and Les tussle for power and Ashley intervenes when the chaos begins to affect business.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is delighted when a go-kart is brought in to be restored, while Tyler gets carried away in his eagerness to impress his father.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The crew refurbishes a 1952 powerboat, and Rick Wade restores a 1940s tricycle for a museum.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Barry Clifford takes a final shot at digging up lost Templar treasure, while Scott Wolter uncovers an important relic that may be a link to the Templar-Pirate connection.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The investigation into the killings of an elderly couple in Oregon, asking whether they were the victims of someone on the rampage or if the murders were more carefully planned.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers attend auctions in Ponder, but face stiff competition from the locals, who seem to have inside knowledge on the contents of the lockers.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit Mesquite, where Ricky and Bubba compete over a collection of antique horse-riding gear.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Everyone's eyes are on Seth as he tries to prove he is worthy of being in charge, while also attempting to keep calm as the pressure begins to mount.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth makes a costly mistake that threatens to land the business in financial disaster. While he tries to correct it, Ashley spills the beans to Les.

programme.title: UFO Europe
programme.desc: Unknown objects, weird lights and a shocking criminal investigation - check out Scotland's Livingston UFO, Norway's Hessdalen lights and Portugal's Castelo de Bode Dam encounter.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: The year 1947 saw an unprecedented wave of UFO sightings that propelled the phenomenon to the world stage. Giorgio Tsoukalos examines the US Air Force's findings.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: For many people, the most credible UFO reports are those raised by police officers. This programme investigates the most significant reports from police records.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts examine evidence that aliens may have visited Mecca's Grand Mosque and Jerusalem's Temple Mount.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick gives a 1967 motorbike an overhaul, but finds refurbishing a 1940s mailbox is not as straightforward as he expected.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team tries to restore a 1960s motorbike ride and a damaged bumper car from the 1950s.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items arriving in the show include an 1800s Colt revolver, an antique Chinese fingernail guard, a life mask of Abraham Lincoln and a Playboy magazine used in the movie Forrest Gump.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Madonna's 1988 day planner arrives at the shop, along with a 1910 phrenology head, but it remains to be seen which is the most valuable.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Two rivals go head to head to claim a $20,000 storage locker, while Jarrod Schulz gets into an argument with Brandi Passante over a dubious unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss finds a miniature piano in a locker full of hair salon supplies, while Dave Hester makes a bid for a unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders visit state capital Austin, where Moe and Mary compete for a locker worth $8,000

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba demonstrate they have a mean side as tensions rise during the last day of auctions in Austin.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: The competitors are tasked with turning salvaged junkyard steel into a weapon, before two go on to craft the legendary Charay sword.

programme.title: The Great UFO Conspiracy
programme.desc: According to a 2012 survey, more people in the UK believe in the existence of aliens than in God, and more than a quarter of people think that evidence of UFOs has been covered up by the government. In this documentary, writer and comedian Dan Schreiber sets out to track down those behind the current ET conspiracy theories, meeting some of the biggest voices in the UFO community in an attempt to find out why so many people are captivated by extraterrestrial mysteries.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Between 1981 and 2011, cameras on Nasa space shuttles have picked up many images of UFOs that experts still struggle to explain.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos from Ancient Aliens investigates whether extra-terrestrial beings lie at the heart of some of Earth's most famous mysteries.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate stories of a French church that supposedly contains a gateway to another universe and an alien library believed to be hidden underneath the Great Sphinx of Giza.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les works at breakneck pace to customise a $20,000 ring, but Seth is furious when Ashley unjustifiably derails the sale.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer is furious when Seth rumbles him for trying to flog fake goods. Later, panic grips the staff as a farmer lets an animal loose in the shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The experts head to Long Beach, California, where high-end imports and low-income housing mean that every unit is a risky purchase.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders visit an upmarket retirement community, where Darrell Sheets buys a unit filled with furniture, and Jarrod Schulz takes a gamble on a safe.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Among the oddities brought in is a 1950s toy lie detector, and Chum must decide whether to make an honest offer when he takes charge of the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A shower curtain signed by Anthony Perkins from Alfred Hitchcock's classic 1960 thriller Psycho, arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: A massive week-long storm tears Morgan's homestead apart, while Mike goes on the offensive for the annual awakening of Kodiak's bears.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's inexperienced brother has to take over from Colin on a job, a trailer has an accident on a blind corner and ends up badly damaged, and Brandon takes on a new role.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Two rivals go head to head to claim a $20,000 storage locker, while Jarrod Schulz gets into an argument with Brandi Passante over a dubious unit.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry Weiss finds a miniature piano in a locker full of hair salon supplies, while Dave Hester makes a bid for a unit.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a Christmas edition of the peculiar panel quiz, asking Sarah Millican, Phill Jupitus, Danny Baker and regular panellist Alan Davies a range of questions on the suitably festive topic of jingle bells, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Angela Barnes, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Miles Jupp join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and asks a range of unusual questions about jobs, finding out how much Sarah Millican, David Mitchell, the Rev Richard Coles and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the subject.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a Christmas edition of the peculiar panel quiz, asking Sarah Millican, Phill Jupitus, Danny Baker and regular panellist Alan Davies a range of questions on the suitably festive topic of jingle bells, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Anita Rani, Chris Ramsey, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games this week.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Angela Barnes, Rob Beckett, Ed Byrne, Milton Jones and Miles Jupp join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle become action sport film directors as they realise their dream of creating a Zombie vs Parkour chase scene.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: A man calls 999 claiming his car has been stolen, but when the vehicle turns up crashed into a wall with cans of cider in the footwell, James is suspicious to say the least.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The duo travel to London, where they consider buying a rare motorbike and a telephone box with a risque history.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Tarrell 'T-Money' Wright makes a shocking revelation, while a group of new bidders comes to town.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are determined to land their most profitable auction to date, and Desert Dan returns.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank uncover an impressive hoard, and strike gold in an unusual prop shop.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike comes across a 150-year-old guitar that could be the valuable find he has been searching for.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell. He and the gang turn a Chevy C10 into a monster of a car, complete with scars and rivets.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson attempts to build a car that is even smaller than the Peel P50 and then tests it out on the streets of London before pitching his concept in the Dragons' Den. James May puts the Bentley Continental GT Speed through its paces by taking it on a rally stage, while Richard Hammond drives the new Pagani Huayra hypercar before handing it over to the Stig. Actor Damian Lewis goes for a spin in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Documentary series following the work of the Nottinghamshire Police force through officers' body-worn cameras.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Reality TV show following the exploits of eccentric master fabricator Steve Darnell. This week he and the gang build a Vegas-inspired motor for a flashy client..

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The trio of motoring enthusiasts embark on another epic road trip, this time across western America in front-engined supercars. Jeremy Clarkson pilots the Lexus LFA, which has a spectacularly high-revving V10 powerplant, Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the muscular Dodge Viper, and James May opts for the latest incarnation of Aston Martin's Vanquish. On their journey from Las Vegas to Palm Springs via Los Angeles, the presenters tackle racing circuits and find themselves in a race against the police, before rushing to the Mexican border - and there's a terrifying penalty for the last man to arrive. Meanwhile, Fleetwood Mac drummer Mick Fleetwood rolls up his sleeves to thrash the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on a race from London's Wembley Stadium to Milan's San Siro, the home of Italian football giants AC and Inter. A price restriction leads Jeremy to grab the keys to a Shelby Mustang GT500, which costs the equivalent of Â£35,000 in America and packs a supercharged punch of more than 650bhp. James and Richard pin their hopes on the pan-European rail network in a bid to secure the prize of tickets to a top-flight football match, with nothing but a long journey home awaiting the losers. On the test track, Jeremy puts Toyota's GT86 coupe through its paces, and its promise of entertaining rear-wheel-drive handling should put a smile on his face. Plus, singer-songwriter Amy Macdonald gets to grips with the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended version of the quiz with a difference, with guests Matt Lucas, Lucy Porter and Ross Noble joining regular panellist Alan Davies, focusing on medical matters.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedian Chris Ramsey and broadcasters Anita Rani, Janet Ellis and Jamie Theakston continue the daily test of their general knowledge skills. Hosted by Richard Osman.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Fashionista Trinny Woodall, actor Reece Shearsmith, West End star Michael Ball and critic Charlie Brooker join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show, in which they try to dupe their opponents with plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: Highlights from the third series of the comedy panel show presented by Rob Brydon. Featuring team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack alongside guests including Fern Britton, Ken Livingstone, Davina McCall, Russell Howard and Claudia Winkleman.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Sean Lock, Lee Nelson and Ed Byrne
programme.desc: Sean Lock hosts the stand-up show recorded at London's Hammersmith Apollo, welcoming comedians to share their light-hearted views on modern life. Sean gives his take on female role models for his daughters, and introduces routines by Lee Nelson, who provides his views on street riots, and Irish funnyman Ed Byrne.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: David Baddiel shows a readiness to bare his chest and Katy Wix robs a piggy bank. Meanwhile, Alex is powerless in the face of Ed Gamble's creative vision.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and finds out how much Julia Zemiro, Tim Vine, Rob Brydon and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the theme of jolly, awarding points for the most interesting answers.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts a special edition that poses questions on all manner of inventions, including some that proved to be 'just the job'. Trying to come up with interesting answers are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson, comedian Jason Manford, broadcaster Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of London's Shard, revealing how it was influenced by the Milan Metro, concrete grain storage in Minnesota and a lifting mechanism in the Venice shipyards.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hitler's Miracle Weapons
programme.desc: Unusual weapons created by German scientists during the Second World War, including giant cannons, V2 rockets and a 200-ton tank, and how they influenced future arms developments.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Real Ark of the Covenant
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston goes in search of the location of the real Ark of the Covenant, believed to be held in a chapel in Ethiopia that is now in dire need of repair.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the US navy's most advanced nuclear submarine - which can remain underwater for months at a time - examining the previous vessels that influenced it.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels along the 100-mile stretch of coast between Holyhead and Liverpool. Miranda Krestovnikoff searches for one of the longest-living creatures on the planet in the Menai Straits, while Alice Roberts discovers how a young survivor of a shipwreck helped to found modern orthopaedic surgery. Nick Crane investigates beach pebbles, and Neil Oliver looks around a mysterious cave on the Great Orme.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the legend of King Arthur, and looks for evidence of whether the mythical monarch was English, Scottish or Welsh.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the life and work of people in the polar regions, including the residents of Norilsk in Siberia, the coldest city on Earth. He also discovers how the Danish armed forces maintain their country's claim to Greenland's natural resources by mounting a 2,000-mile dog sled patrol during the winter, and finds out how a research base at the South Pole is able to cope with being cut off from the outside world for six months at a time.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A highway built in the Brazilian jungle as an escape route in the event of an emergency at a nuclear power station, a Soviet fortress and Ellis Island hospital.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A Cold War Soviet classic goes under the hammer. Built like a tank, the Moskovitch gets few admirers for style, but finds a loving home with a fan of Eastern Bloc classics.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At South Devon, engineer Ray Lee is working to bring a loco back in to service. There is also a visit to the SS Kingswear paddle steamer In Dartmouth, the oldest vessel of its kind.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team is under pressure with a record number of cars to auction, but Derek finds room for one more - a replica AC Cobra. A couple are reunited with their Volvo breakdown truck.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Period medical drama chronicling the personal and professional consequences of Eleanor Bramwell's determined quest to become the first female surgeon at the East London Hospital. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B company are called in to help during a fire brigade's strike. Andy Butcher finally plucks up the courage to ask Stacey out.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Samantha is appalled when it becomes clear that psychological profiler Dr Hugh Wallis has brainwashed Abi, who not only refuses to name him as her kidnapper but agrees to return home with him. The situation becomes even more dire when Peter Baxter is charged with the abduction, leaving Samantha wondering how she can convince her colleagues of the terrible truth. Meanwhile, sexy new recruit PC Amber Johannsen turns heads at Sun Hill, although Gina is unimpressed by her slipshod approach to police work, and Ramani crosses swords with an abusive wife and mother.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Tricia has a very emotional day comforting her friend Maggie Thornton in her final hours, and Mickie tries to console Mubbs, who is in a foul mood over Rosie and the baby. Will refuses to apologise to the canteen staff and has to endure taunts about his aristocratic background. As Jess is about to tell Sean and Ric the truth about her pregnancy, she is interrupted by Connie introducing the new head of anaesthetics - who happens to be a familiar face.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Josh confides in Baz over the devastation of losing his family, while Matt tells Jude he is going to Crete in part because of the upset over the abortion. The battle between two warring families spills into the hospital wards.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim makes a partial confession to June about his debts, leaving her in no mood to enjoy her retirement party, preferring to drown her sorrows rather than facing up to the reality of her husband's betrayal. As the booze flows freely, Amber makes a bee-line for Steve and promptly seduces the virginal copper - doubtless setting the scene for plenty of emotional tempests to come. By contrast, Ramani's professionalism impresses Jack so much he puts her in charge of a new Vulnerable Persons Unit.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: There are difficult decisions to be made for the Taverniers, and the Fowlers get some bad news.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Life and death decisions cause discord at the Fowlers'.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Two building workers are buried under collapsed scaffolding at the edge of a river, and Josie is one of the first women to attend the junior officers' training course.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The dodgy dealer is threatened by a debt collector over a long outstanding sum and his hopes of meeting the repayment rest on a silver tankard, and hijacking a local auction administered by Charlotte Cavendish to obtain an antique piece of Japanese pottery. Meanwhile, newcomer Beth Taylor gives Eric and Tinker a helping hand. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim is assigned to protect a demanding tennis player who has received several death threats. The amiable cop tries to keep his personal feelings in check in the course of his professional duties. John Nettles and Reece Dinsdale star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Jack's van is held up at gunpoint and Adrian announces he has found a girlfriend. Meanwhile, Billy becomes increasingly frustrated over Julie's attitude to their relationship.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe's beloved cat goes missing, so she turns to Mr Humphries for support in her hour of need. Fearing the feline may never return, the staff buy her a kitten. John Inman and Mollie Sugden star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean and Lionel travel to Los Angeles to discuss turning their story into a film, but the brash executive deciding their fate doesn't allay their fears. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Afterthoughts of a Co-op Manager
programme.desc: Truly discovers a former suitor of Marina's went off to Australia, and convinces her the emigrant did so to forget about her - and that she should stop seeing Howard out of respect to the other man's memory. Long-running comedy series, starring Frank Thornton, Jean Fergusson and Robert Fyfe.

programme.title: The Inspector Lynley Mysteries
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The murder of famous cricketer Kenneth Waring presents Lynley with a fresh challenge to his deductive powers _ and as the case unfolds, he is forced to break the rules in a desperate bid to lure the killer into the open. Nathaniel Parker, Sharon Small and Lesley Vickerage star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The penultimate episode sees the retired detectives investigating possibly their most difficult cold case yet. A bloodstained bust is uncovered during construction work in a cemetery and the evidence points to the murder of an alternative-medicine practitioner seven years earlier. Further clues lead to the controversial world of cryopreservation - the practice of keeping clinically dead patients frozen to extend their life cycle. Sasha is determined they don't put a foot wrong - but with the sobering possibility that two perpetrators are still at large, the detectives are forced to go out on a limb.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Craggy cop Jim Taggart investigates the murder of an undertaker found in a burnt-out car, and soon realises that all the evidence points to local French teacher Francoise Campbell, whose pupils seem strangely anxious to protect her. Whodunit, starring Mark McManus, James MacPherson, Iain Anders and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: Retirees from Padstow blow a big budget on an oak porch for their renovation, and a property transformation in Liverpool uncovers a slice of history. Elsewhere, the development of a loft conversion for a family living in North London does not go according to plan.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom..

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: The women put the world to rights once more, discussing everything from politics to parenting, and invite a celebrity guest to chat about what they are up to - or anything else that takes their fancy.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson helps members of the public in Solihull sort the treasures from their trash. Henry Nicholls tries to get his hands on a military watch and Fay Rutter cannot believe her luck when she is faced with 35 sovereign coins. But how much is she willing to pay? Jan Keyne gets a lesson in profit-making and Simon Schneider gets an offer he can refuse.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five friends calling themselves the Science Alliance answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Craig, Michala, Harry and Frances pit their wits against quiz genius the Chaser. Answering general knowledge questions, they each add as much money as they dare to the jackpot - but if anyone is caught they're out for good, leaving fewer players for the final chase.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: As more drama unfolds during the opening day of Hawkford Outdoor Pursuits, Andrea makes a discovery, and Belle is left confused.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: It is the opening day of Hawksford Outdoor Pursuits, and while Rhona surprises Marlon, he is left determined.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Holidays: Bagging a Bargain Break - Tonight
programme.desc: Helen Skelton presents a report on the tourism industry, asking how easy it will be to get a bargain holiday in 2020 in the aftermath of the Thomas Cook collapse.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: Major documentary telling the inside story of the royal family and the Queen's record-breaking reign. The first episode focuses on the conflict between love and duty that faces the royals - and which has occasionally threatened to bring down the House of Windsor. Edward VIII fatefully chose love when he abdicated to marry divorcee Wallis Simpson. Charles chose duty when he married Diana. The Queen, however, has managed to find a balance, maintaining a long marriage while becoming the longest-serving monarch.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: At a time of year when many people feel the pinch in both their wallets and their waistlines, the consumer health show returns, presented by Sian Williams and Ranj Singh. Over the series they compare 12 of the latest diets, beginning with the 16:8 intermittent fasting diet and a meal replacement shake plan. They also find out how it's possible to have a drink ruining blowing a diet, investigating some of the latest low-calorie and low-alcohol tipples on the market.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: After Will and Leonard witness a deadly and deliberate hit-and-run, Geordie traces the car to a pair of decidedly dysfunctional brothers, whose house lies far off the beaten path. The victim's wife, his employee and the two brothers are all damaged characters caught in a web of lies and betrayals - and it's not just secrets hiding within the siblings' grounds. Back at home, Will and Geordie both struggle as unwelcome guests look set to stay - Will's mum Amelia seems to have found a carbon copy of his late father in her new beau. Meanwhile, a new television set lands in the vicarage - just in time for Eurovision. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How plasterboard is made from power station smoke, the casting of the world's top awards, and how planes are built that can take off and land almost anywhere.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags an American classic, Chevrolet Corvette Stingray - but it has only been part-restored, so it is up to mechanic Edd China to complete the job.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini visits the Lee Roy Hartung collection, where he discovers an original Hertz car from the 1920s and a one-off 1949 Veritas.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini hopes a fishing rod and canoe will add to the value of his 1939 Ford Standard Woodie Wagon.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that capture a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of train crash explosions, storm chasers who narrowly escape death, a window platform smashing into a building, cars and trucks colliding and a helicopter accident.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Footage of firefighters caught up in an explosion, missile warheads exploding in a tunnel, an avalanche burying a city, and a racing car snapping in two at 310mph.

programme.title: Extreme Loggers
programme.desc: The Garden River team makes good progress, but there is trouble at the Reno site when a dumper breaks down.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team revamp a petrol-head's 1964 Chevy Malibu when they learn she has always dreamed of owning a muscle car.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how seaweed is turned into sushi wrapping, how beer bottles that last for 15 years are made, and how surfers try to keep themselves safe from sharks.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restorers face a challenge with Chesterfield sofa rescued from the scrapheap. Plus, they set out to revive a shattered marble figurine and a broken French bakery counter.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fleet pushes operations into overdrive as the end of the season approaches, but another challenge begins as soon as the job comes to an end. Meanwhile, the Northwestern returns to Seattle, where all the families are waiting, and Edgar meets his son for the first time.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The crews make the most of the last few days of the season as winter descends on Nome, before facing off at an auction for next year's dredging grounds.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Turbo pushes his luck, and his truck, as he tries to go the distance and deliver his load, while Bob tackles a mountain of timber.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Edd China and Mike Brewer set the challenge to find the ultimate bug-out vehicle that would ceaselessly run, and decide on the Land Rover Series IIA.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Steve, Sharpie and Andy take on Metcalfe's biggest ever job moving three massive oil rig sections. Simon and Paul bite off more than they can chew in a dockside move.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: A strange cave freezes in summer and melts in winter, and a huge sand dune swallows a small child in an instant. Rob and Stefan explore these mysteries.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Legendary train driver Bernie Baker needs all the diesel-muscle he can muster when he takes five Streamliner locos on a 2,500km odyssey across the searing Outback. The work of rail staff operating routes through the Australian wilderness.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The red king crab season gets under way once more, and the trawlers prepare for the weeks of toil ahead. However, events take a dramatic turn when an emergency distress signal sounds throughout the fishing fleet.

programme.title: Gold Divers: Under the Ice
programme.desc: Three teams of miners embark on a search for the precious metal under 4ft of solid ice on the floor of the Bering Sea between Russia and Alaska.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits the Wirral, where he tours a stately home that doubles as an antique shop, and finds so much worth buying that he worries his finances might be in trouble.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Steve Grahame receives a double dose of bad luck during a brutal lap through the red centre. Plus, Turbo is back, battling to get his business out of a rut.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer bags an American classic, Chevrolet Corvette Stingray - but it has only been part-restored, so it is up to mechanic Edd China to complete the job.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restoration team transforms a shabby set of apothecary drawers, refreshes a French Victorian seat and saves a 1960s chandelier that witnessed a Beatle's wedding.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Lancashire, Drew Pritchard visits a sprawling salvage yard that yields many unique items. Next, at an auction house, he faces off against other dealers in a bidding war.

programme.title: Goblin Works Garage
programme.desc: The team take on a Japanese sports car legend - the Toyota Supra. These cars have been modified countless times, so how can they make theirs stand out?.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard and Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland head to the Midlands to look at a Swedish classic - the Volvo Amazon. When Paul falls for an early Toyota MR2, he seeks a way to convince Drew it will turn a profit.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How car windows are made to keep out wind and rain, stones, thieves, noise and harmful UV rays. Plus, a look at the way gloss is added to create the perfect shade of lipstick.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how George Washington's favourite tipple is made, how aircraft seats are tested without crashing a plane, and the manufacturing processes behind billions of batteries.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Brian Wilson's wife, Inga, goes missing after a late-night run to the store. Her body later turns up 15 miles away from their family home.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Police use trace evidence and paint analysis to track down a killer preying on male prostitutes. Saliva and ink found at the scene of a murder help link a husband to his estranged wife's death.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: In the 2013 film The Purge, the US government legalises all crime for 12 hours once a year. For one fan, the film's ideas inspired him to play out his darkest desires.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two young women failed to return home from the local drive-thru. As their parents began a search for them, a fisherman gave police their first clue.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI is alerted when a female Army officer fails to report for work and a mysterious bloodstain is found at her home. Her husband comes under suspicion of murder because of his violent history, but the investigators find little evidence to implicate him.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: It's touch and go for German shepherd Zeus as the Animal Cops medical team works through the night to remove a collar embedded in his neck.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is visited by Mr Wilson the shar-pei puppy, Martha the alligator, Cheeky the bird and Polar the samoyed - a snow coloured Siberian dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: There's a New Guy in Town
programme.desc: The company hires its first male consultant, a bride clashes with her sister, and a customer wants a dress for an Orthodox Jewish wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: After losing seven stone, Stephanie wants to show off her new figure in a sexy wedding dress, while Akisha worries her outfit will not impress her fiance.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Holly wants to look like a princess, but her mother and grandma have other ideas, while Lauren has yet to lay eyes on her custom-made ballgown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown meets a cormorant missing half its beak, and practice makes perfect for some budding vets. A dog has a hip problem - and there is only one way to fix it.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Police raid a cockfight, and a couple who foster unwanted animals find they have too many to cope with.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The animal protection officers pull out all the stops to help three neglected horses that have become so desperately hungry, even sand is food.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore sees what people are about to throw away at a Surrey recycling centre, rescuing two car axle stands, a farmhouse table and some rusty old railings for transformation.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How victims' family members and friends can assist police in their inquiries after the body of a missing person is found and identified.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 37-year-old nurse Tammy Kingery, who vanished in September 2014 after leaving work early complaining of sickness. Her family found a note saying she had gone for a walk, and the police investigation revealed secrets that lead to dark theories about the fate of the mother-of-three.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The cases of Elijah 'Bear' Diaz and Skylar Tosic, who vanished within hours of each other in southern California. Family and friends of both 20-year-olds contemplated whether the two cases might be linked.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Consultant Jessica has her hands full with a bride-to-be who has obsessive-compulsive disorder.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah and her husband visit the salon to find a gown for their 10th anniversary vow renewal, while Jodee wants to look sexy on her wedding day.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having beaten cancer, Kristin is ready to marry her high-school sweetheart, while Latoya wants a ball gown with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former pageant consultant and part-time model Ashely dreams of a gown she tried on at a different salon.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Candice is shopping with her mother, with three weeks to go until her wedding, while Jacy arrives at the salon with an entourage.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: You're Sexy and You Know It
programme.desc: Belly-dancing paralegal Sahar has her fitting, while Aimee goes in search of a tight dress with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Stella brings along an entourage ahead of her Greek wedding, while Carli arrives for her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle shares the spotlight with her mother, Afrodite argues with her mum over fashion and Lindsey wants hers to attend the fitting.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At a 13th-century manor house in Yorkshire, Drew Pritchard uncovers a wartime flag with a medical history. He also visits a neo-gothic cathedral in Edinburgh.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore sees what people are about to throw away at a Surrey recycling centre, rescuing two car axle stands, a farmhouse table and some rusty old railings for transformation.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: When Annjeannette was nine, a public campaign was set up to send her to fat camp. The fat-shaming has continued, and she has struggled with food addiction.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Ian Huntley's ex-girlfriend and daughter tell their side of the story. The pair explain how Huntley abused them for years, before they eventually ended all contact with him.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: Detectives, friends and family reveal the twists and turns that led to tragedy, and where it all went wrong - revealing the 10 steps to murder..
